Et ij sholez ferro non ligat, ij vange, iij mukhakkez et j yrenhake, ij sacci, j poke pro granis portandis, iiij riddillez, ij sevez, j windowclathe, j modius, xij wedhukez, iij gang et di. de felys pro rotis inde fiendis, iij gang del spekys, ij plogheuedez, x juga bovina, vj harpice, j par del stokkez, Ml asseres et di., MlMl tegul. et di., j plumbum, j mashfatt et ij alia fattes, xxx arcus boum, ij wymbillez, j kar, et j capstane. It. iij scale, x axes pro plaustris. It. xliij bordez quarccuum, ij moldbredez. It. j fothr' de palis et virgis et j fothr' del wattylle. It. ij mukforkez, iij yrenforkez. It. ij cupe. It. ij rote parvule pro j charyete ferro ligate. It., in Granar. j archa, j fat, et j hoppyr et j lepe pro granis portandis. It. est ibidem j neche. It. rem. ibidem iij quart. et di. frumenti, ij quart. vj bus. siliginis, vj quart. ordei, ij (illegible). It. in orreo, viij fothr' feni et c trave straminis pro tectura. It. seminat. in campis ejusdem manerii (illegible) xxiiij acr., cum siligine, xx acr., cum ordeo xlvj acr., cum avenis l acr. Item rem. ibidem ij galli, viij galline, iij capones, ij auce, et iij auce, ciij (?) anceruli.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. fr. Ric. Bell, 1454-5.
DIV2.P: Exp. Ferr. Hisp.; ferr. de Weerdale.
Dona, etc. Repar. S. Osw. per preceptum Prioris, 21s.
No entry of Episc. pu. Elem.
Reparac. A long account (buildings, etc.).
Contrib., etc. Pro molusione clausure voc. Furnace∣close, xxd.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1455-6.
DIV2.P: Exp. Pro panno et reparacione Aqueductus Manerii de Elvet (as last year), 3s. 4d.
Dona, etc. No Episc. pu. Elem.
Reparac. Usual long list of minor repairs, including "Joh'i Plomer pro tectura medietatis camere vocate Kyngeschaumbr'."
Contr. Pro molusione prati vocat. lez Allers; pro defensione aque de Wer.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1456-7.
DIV2.P: Exp. (Usual hogsheads of red wine from N.C. and in villa). Et in vino dulci emp. in villa, 27s. (Both wine and Spanish iron bought of Alan Bird, of N.C.) (Usual cloth, and repairs of Elvethall aqueduct). Et in j brewlede and j capstane emp. pro ten. nuper in tenura, etc., iiijs.; pro nova vitriacione j fenestre in ecclesia Sci. Oswaldi ex consensu d'ni Prioris, 33s. 4d.; et in j sylour cum lez curtyns emp. pro principali lecto in le Water∣chambr', 10s.
Dona, etc. Episc. puerili Elem., 3s. 4d.

Repar., etc. Pro operacione et preparacione meremii ad edificacionem lez Ilynges in Aula Hospitali, 6s. 8d.; carpentario pro completo opere dict. lez Ilynges in Aula predicta, 36s. 8d.; pro prostracione meremii veteris tecti eorundem lez Ilynges, 3s. 4d.; Joh. Plomber pro operacione et tectura x fothr' di. plumbi super lez Ilynges in aula predicta, 63s.; diversis mulieribus pro traccione straminis pro tectura domorum per tempus compoti, 14s.; operanti super Aulam Hospitalem in emendacione murorum lez Ilynges, 3s. 6d.
Contrib. Molusio seems to be now a regular thing.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Joh'is Midilham, 1457-8. (In a decayed, torn and dirty condition.)
DIV2.P: Exp. Pro factura del colars pro equis carect. In j equo empt. de Thoma Person et prestito J. . . . d'ni Regis et sic perdito, xiijs. iiijd. Et in iij dd. et di. cirothecarum emp. apud Oxon. et dat. servient., 8s. 7d. Et in cc del wardons emp. erga festum Natalis D'ni, 2s.
Dona, etc. Episc. puerili Elem., 3s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp., 1458. (So labelled. Too far gone to be handled.)
Comp. ejusdem, 1458-9. (On paper).
DIV2.P: Dona, etc. Et Ep'o puerili Elem., 3s. 6d., crossed out. Uni famulo Roberti Chesman portanti ferinam, 12d.; et in 20s. datis ad pontem de Elvet.
Reparac. Will. Bron et Ade Nobill pro nova factura molendini de Shynckley, 24s. 8d. Then follows a long account of all particulars.
Summa, 45li. 15s. 10d.
Alloc. Et petit allocac' pro stacione molend. de Schyncley per 9 septimanas, 9s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Will. Cuthbert, Name ascertained from roll of 1462-3. 1459-60.
DIV2.P: Repar., etc. Carpentario pro opere in Aula hospitali (et laborantibus); operanti ibidem cum ij famulis in factura j entreclosewall; pro j saa pro aqua portanda, 6d.; pro factura j nove fenestre in quadam camera voc. Clerke∣chaumbre; pro vitriacione ejusdem; pro emendacione diversarum fenestrarum vitrearum in le Waterchaumbre, 2s.; Will'o Glasyer de Eboraco pro vitriacione unius fenestre in Scaccario continent. xxij pedes et di. ad xd. minus in toto ixd., 18s.; Joh'i Plumber pro factura j gutter; in factura j coopertorii lignei pro le stepled, cum opere carpentr. fact. circa molendinum de Shyncliff et lez Watertrowe, ac factura j pontis de Whytwelborne; pro pice et bitumine emp. pro molendino de Shyn∣clyff. Et tenentibus de Shyncliff pro cariag. meremii a parco de Shyncliff usque molendinum ibidem et manerium de Elvethall; pro cariag. ij fother del watellez et dalbyng∣stowres a Beaurepayr. (punctuatio, tectura, stramen, etc.).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, Name ascertained from roll of 1462-3. 1460-61. (Nearly all the top is gone, but lxo just visible).
DIV2.P: Exp. j par de tracez pro harpic., 4d.
Dona, etc. Homini . . portanti ferinam 12d. (now a regular entry).

Repar. domor. A long account of repairs of tenements, etc.; work in choir and church of St. Oswald for 2 and 3½ days; window in Clerkchamber and glazing of same; work in le Wynterhall; Et Joh'i Knath pro operacione de le corbellez in choro Sci. Oswaldi per xij dies ad 4d., 4s.; Willelmo Kervour pro operacione facta in cancello Sci. Oswaldi, 76s. 8d.; pro prostracione et deposicione dicti cancelli, 20s.; sawing, wainscot, carpenter's work in choir of St. Oswald's; Joh. Sclater pro operacione super le Watershawmer (pointing, roofing, stone, lime, nails, crooks, bands, straw, etc.).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1461-2.
DIV2.P: Exp. Ferr. Hisp. et de Weerdale, the latter bought of Ric. Blomer; et pro operacione ejusdem.
Dona, etc. Ep'o puerili Elem., 3s. 4d.

Rep. domor. Will. Plomer pro tectura ij plaustrat. plumbi in le entre in Aula Hospitali; id. in le Kynges∣chambr'; pro factura murorum in Aula Hospitali per 25 dies; pro factura jus muri ante ortum ibidem; pro latamis operantibus super factur' novarum fenestrarum in Aula Hospitali, 109s. 4d.; pro vitriacione dictarum fenestrarum una cum xjs. ijd. solut. pro plumbo et electro emp. pro eisdem, 73s. 8d. Rob. Sclater pro tectura lapidum super tenementa; in le cowpenalys (and other nails).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1462-3.
DIV2.P: Arrears of first, second, and third years of Will. Cuthbert are mentioned after those of Joh. Midelham; this, then, must be the fourth year of W. Cuthbert).
Rec. De corticibus et croppez has occurred regularly from the first; sometimes it is nil.

Exp. Pro emendacione unius cathedre in Aula Hospitali; pro lez mattes emp. pro Aula ibidem; pro j par de lez fustians pro Aula Hospitali; d'no Will. Cuthbert in celebrac' prime misse, 6s. 8d. (a frequent entry); Joh'i Armerer pro purgacione armorum, 6s.
Repar. Usual long list; tenements; Shincliffe mill.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1463-4.
DIV2.P: Exp. Ric. Smyth pro factura de le milne irennys de Schynnecley, 8d. . . pro le byrtenyng ix plaustr., ixd. Et in le frenys empt. de Matild. Pikering, penden. circa lectum infra le Knightchambr', 14d. Et in diversis cordis emptis de Johanne Syvier pro Aula Hospitali pro lectis pendend., 8d. Et in j scuttyl empt., 7d.
Dona, etc. Et parochianis Ecclesie Sci. Oswaldi pro organis noviter empt., 6s. 8d. Et parochianis Capelle S'ce Margarete pro campan. noviter empt., 6s. 8d.

Repar. A long account. Tenements and Shincliffe mill. Pro emendacione molendini de Shynneclyff subtus lez spyndill, 20d. . . (carpentario) pro le crowbyng unius
plumbi in tenura Agnetis Plummer, 5d. (Several repairs and makings of new plumbi in divers tenure). 10 fodir tegularum a querrera de Essh; diversis mulieribus pro traccione straminis (as usual).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1464-5.
DIV2.P: Exp. Joh. Lokesmyth pro emendacione unius sere infra le Somerhall et alterius sere ostii de le Waters∣chamber, 6d.; pro suicione del costardes infra Cameram Militis; pro le flokkys emp. pro le bolsteres, 23d.; pro emendacione de le milneirennys molendini de Shynneclyff, 8d.; pro j roda novi operis de lez cundeth apud Elvethall, 12d.

Rep. dom. Pro iij cersinis calsis albe emp. pro albifiacione camerarum infra Hospicium, 9s. 10d.; pro Ml. sarkyngnale, 5s. Et in nova factura trabis sive supercilii Camere Militis infra Hospicium, viz., in meremio, tectura plumbea, una cum iiijor plaustratis plumbi emp., cum emendacione et exaltacione murorum, ac in opere latamo∣rum, cum direpcione et deposicione antique trabis ejusdem, cum omnimodis aliis expensis super illam factis, ut patet per papirum computantis, 44li. 12½d. Et in vitriacione jus fenestre in le Barry cum vitro empt., vjs.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. fratris Thome Hawghton, 1466-7 (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Dec. De piscar. de Lomley nil hoc anno, quia vastatur, tamen reddere solebat per annum, 2s.
Exp. Et in 27½ uln. Holandcloth ad 8d. . . pro bridilbetez et girthbukyls empt., 10d.

Rep. dom. Operantibus super facturam murorum lapid. unius beerhouse; pro le riddyng ramalium dicte domus; yconomis eccl. S. Osw. pro 51 plaustr. lapid.; operant. infra manerium super factura murorum lapid. de le byrehouse ex novo erect.; le riddyng fundi dicte domus; in opere carpentrie le byrehouse predicte; pro sarracione ij rod. meremii et bordarum pro le byre; Sacriste Dunelm. pro iiijxx xij plaustrat. (lapidum?) ex eo emp. pro le byre et ten. predict. ad 2½d. pro car. lapid. a querrera Sacriste usque Elvett; pro punctuacione super le haverbarne infra manerium (et) super le bygbern (and a long account of usual repairs).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1467-8 (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Dec. (As last year).
Exp. Sol. pro ijbus novis fethirbeddez, 33s. 4d.; pro mundacione suere de le Langmeredyke, 2s. 4½d.
Rep. dom. Operanti super factura murorum molendini de Shyneclyff et sectur. stram. ejusdem molendini.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1468-9.
DIV2.P: Rec. Var. Et de 20s. rec. pro duobus equis antiquis et debilibus sic venditis hoc anno.

Exp. Pro factura 53 rod. fossat. circa unam parcellam terre juxta parcum de Shynkcley pro salvacione de le Spryng ibidem ad 3d., 13s. 9d. Sol. pro mundacione fossati circa le Conyngerth apud Maydencastell . . 7s.
(This Cony-garth has been mentioned before, as being beyond the top of Elvet, or something to that effect).
Dona, etc. Episcopo puerili, 3s. 4d. (After some years' abeyance).

Repar., etc. Operanti super factura murorum lapid. ij ten. in Elvett de novo construct. et le dalbyng lez pentessez, enterclosewallz, caminorum luteorum, et posicione arearum eorundem ten. per 39 dies et di., unde 23½ ad 5d. et 13 ad 4d., 15s. 4½d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1469-70.
DIV2.P: Dona, etc. Ep'o puerili, 3s. 4d.
Repar. Long account of usual matters.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1470-1.
DIV2.P: Exp. In uno dolio vini rubii emp. de Johanne Saumple de Novo Castro, 6li. Et pro cariagio ejusdem cum 8d. solut. portatoribus, 2s. 8d. (a large purchase of wine like this occurs frequently). Pro mundacione unius suere apud le Pethmedowe, 6s. 3d.
Dona, etc. Et in donis dat. d'no Rob'to Ebchestr Custodi Collegii Oxon. ad suam incepcionem, 13s. 4d.
(No Ep's puerilis).
Repar. Le Bygbarne; and many tenure, etc.

Contrib. Et in contribucione facta ex imposicione d'ni Prioris in anuali capitulo, 10li. (these contributions, varying in amount, yearly); et sol. feretrario in relevamen officii sui ex ordinacione d'ni Prioris, 20s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1471-2.
DIV2.P: Dec. Lumley fishery still yielding nil.
Exp. Red wine only, 33s. 4d. (see last year); pro factura 20 rod. fossat. in Elvetwod circa le Sprynge ad 2d., 3s. 4d.
Dona, etc. Ep'o puerili, 3s. 6d.
Repar. Et eidem (Will. Plommer) pro operacione cca vxx viij petr. plumbi in iiij warkledes, brewledes, et j steplede ad jd. ob., xliijs. vjd.
Contrib. As above, 6li. 13s. 4d. and 20s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1472-3 (and a duplicate).
DIV2.P: Exp. Dolium of red wine, 6li. 13s. 4d.; j dd. et di. vasorum electr., 21s. 8d.; ij fethirbeddes, bolsters, et pilows.
Don. Ep'o puerili, 3s. 6d.
Repar. Pro dealbacione murorum cancelli Eccl. Sci. Oswaldi, 2s. 4d.; pro pice, bitumine, et flokkis empt. pro molendino de Shyncley, 16d.
Contr. 10li. and 20s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1473-4 (three copies).
DIV2.P: Don. No Ep's puerilis.
Rep. Pro una cupa, tribul', et bollez empt., viijd.; operanti in dalbura murorum ten. in tenura clerici paroch. ecclesie Sci. Oswaldi.
Contr. 10li. et 20s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1474-5.
DIV2.P: Dona. No Ep's puerilis.
Repar. Pro tectura iiijor rodarum super le whete∣barn Manerii de Elvet, 20s. . . pro tectura columbar' ibidem, 6s. 8d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1479-80.
DIV2.P: Exp. In zinzibere, sinamomo, et aliis speciebus, ac volemis empt., 6s.
Dona. Ep'o puerili, 3s. 4d.
Contr. Ut supra in relevamen Monasterii, 10li.; d'no Regi, 65s. 8d.; feretrario, 20s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. c. 1480; all the top perished.
DIV2.P: Repar. Carpentariis operantibus per iiij dies in lez swardyng meremii apud Shynklyf bankez.
Contr. Prior's impost, 66s. 8d. King for half tenth for church of St. Oswald in spirituals and temporals, 32s. 10d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1480-81. (On good paper; water-mark a star of 8 points).
DIV2.P: Exp. In volemis again. Pro pergameno, papiro, etc.; pro factura sepium circa le Spreyng voc. Shynkley∣banke, 2s.
Don. Ep'o puerili, 3s. 6d.
Repar. Et in pice et bitumine et aliis necessariis pro le trowys dicti molendini (Shynkley), 7s. 1d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Joh. Swane, 1485-6.
DIV2.P: Exp. In j rowndlet vini dulcis continent. xvj lagen., 18s. 8d.; in vxx xij uln. panni linei vocat. Holandecloth, (20 at 14d., 33 at 10d.); pro succisione et le lowkyng de le Spryng juxta silvam de Shynkley per vj dies ad 5d.
Dona, etc. D'nis Thome Swalwell et Henrico Thewe versus Oxon. ex curialitate, 10s. (No Ep. pu.)

Repar. Operanti super dolacione lapidum et posicione unius lyttynglede in tenura Joh. Becham. Et sol. Ric'o Grenwell pro adquisicione dict. lapidum; 2s. pro opera∣cione 79 petr. plumbi operati in j wadlede in ten. Joh. Becham ad 1½d., 9s. 10½d. Pro vitriacione 36 pedum novi operis in Aula Hospicii ad 2d.; operant. in le poyntyng et emendacione murorum columbaris.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Joh'is Swan, 1485-6. (Unfinished. Contains only the receipts, and those as usual. Lumley fishery still unoccupied).
Comp. ejusdem, 1486-7.
DIV2.P: Dona, etc. No Ep's puerilis.
Repar. Sol. Joh'i Grenwell pro adquisicione vj futhrez del thykston', 2s.; Cristoforo More, Plummer, pro operacione 62 petr. plumbi, operant. in j littyngleyde in ten. Joh. Bechem ad 1½d., 7s. 8d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1487-8.
DIV2.P: Exp. Rowndlet vini dulcis: Ginger and cinnamon continue, but there have been no sweetmeats for some time.
Dona. No Ep's puerilis.
Contr. 10li., 20s., 32s. 10d. (ut supra).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1488-9.
DIV2.P: Exp. In 77 uln. panni linei empt. de diversis tenentibus . . 47 uln. panni de le hardyn de eisdem.
Dona, etc. No Ep's puerilis.
Repar. Usual plastering of walls, gables, and chimneys of tenements, and laying of floors (probably plaster or mud), thatching and slating with tegule or stone-thack.
Contr. 10li. and 32s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1489-90.
DIV2.P: Exp. In uno dolio vini rubii, 118s. 4d. Et in j rowndelett de Malvesey, 33s. 4d.
Repar. Enterclose walls mentioned, as frequently.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Galfridi Forest, 1490-91.
DIV2.P: Dona. No Ep's puerilis.
Reparac. Pro dalbura murorum, gabellorum, hallan∣dorum, per 14 dies, in le riddyng fundi dicti ten. per v dies. Pro virgis et lez stowrys.
Contr. 10li., 20s., and subsidy to Bishop of Durham, 8s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1491-2 (and a duplicate).
DIV2.P: Exp. Pro le lukkyng jus Spring apud Thonnokmyre. Pair of millstones for Shincliffe, 23s. 4d., and fixing, 6s. 8d.; pro j steppe pro predicto molendino, 3s. 4d.
Dona. No Ep's puerilis.
Contr. 10li.; 20s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Joh. Danby, 1492-3.
DIV2.P: Receipts only, and the Redd. Resol. Abbati de Alba∣landa, which always appears in the payments.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Henrici Dalton, 1495-6. (Much decayed, can hardly be unrolled).
Comp. Tho. Swalwell, 1505-6.
DIV2.P: Repar. Pro factura unius le synke subtus aula estivali in Hospicio, cum clavis, bitumine, et hujusmodi; carpentariis pro factura graduum et hostii cum le pentese ex parte boriali introitus ad Hospicium; pro vitriacione et emendacione diversarum fenestrarum in scaccario superiori et camera fratrum; pro factura novi armarioli pro evidenciis officii conservandis, 13s. 10d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1508-9.
DIV2.P: Repar. Pro operacione et dealbacione in Aula Hospi∣tali per 42 dies; pro virgis et dalbyng stowris (pro tenuris); solut. Henrico vitratori pro emendacione fenistrarum in Aula Hospitali, 3s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1510-11.
DIV2.P: Reparaciones. Pro emendacione le syler Camere Regie cum 26 petr. crete ad jd., 2s. 2d., una cum pictura et dealbacione murorum ibidem et in aliis cameris hospicii, 15s. 9½d. Pro opere lapideo et vitrie circa emendacionem magne fenestre cancelli Ecclesie S. Oswaldi, 13s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1512-13.
DIV2.P: Reparaciones. In dolacione pro dorsali novo in aula estivali et alibi infra Hospicium, et pro le crobbyng cisternarum in tenuris (2 at 3d.), una cum factura novarum cipparum in manerio ac circa molendinum; factura unius le buttres et guttoure ad finem occidentalem aule estivalis; in factura j le spute ex parte occidentali aule estivalis; et solut. Ricardo Prior pro fossacione sua (et) reparacione unius pontis in le Peth, una pro Sic; lege cum. fossione et opere suo circa altam viam ibidem.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1513.
DIV2.P: Seems not to contain anything special.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1513-4.
DIV2.P: Receipts with Rem., 196li. 16s. 6¼d.

Expens' include in zinzibro, sinomomo, zuccaris, et aliis speciebus, 2s. 6d.; pro 118 ulnis panni linei pro linthiaminibus ex hoc quod antiq. expendebatur in diploidi∣bus pro guerra hoc anno.; pro 12 ulnis grossioris lini ad diversa precia, 2s. 6d.; et sol. pro suicione linthiaminum, 3s. 7d.; pro tribus garniamentis emptis, viz. gromo Aule hospicii, 5s.; stabulario, 5s.; et sumptuario sive avenario, 5s.; (bukketnall', sylynnall' (sylyngnall', 1512-3), takett', tenturhuke); pro j novo cilicio pro ustrino; pro reparacione j lectricinii camere Regis, 6s.; pro ij magnis coopertoriis et ij le spervers pro camera Regis et camera Militis.
Tallia et Indentura. Pro sarculacione, trituracione, et ventilacione bladorum.
Empcio prebende. In pane equino et fabis, etc.

Reparaciones. Pro succisione et preparacione meremii in silva et ad finem ville pro reparacionibus in tenuris subscriptis; pro factura nova le trowes pro molend. de
Shynkley per 20½ dies, cum pice, bitumine, et pilis pro eisdem, et aliis reparacionibus circa dict. molend.; pro factura j pontis lignei ad finem occidentalem Aule Hospicii pro fimo ibidem cariando, 6s. 3d.; punctuacione super orrium decimale de Shynkle et super le byer et domum feni in manerio, et orrea ibidem, et domum latimarum (sic) voc. Westhous, cum punctuacione murorum ibidem; pro combustione unius putei calcis, una cum 17d. pro carboni∣bus; pro tuncione calcis; pro dalbyngstoures; pro vitreacione fenestrarum in Aula et in cameris Hospicii; pro extraccione straminis 14d., una cum 12d. pro le cratels; pro factura j le gutter pro ductu aque de le stepled subter pontem ligneum, et pro muracione sub eodem et reparac' (blank) seu volte latrinarum de le Gesthous per 9 dies et di.
Total exp., 200li. 10s. 11d.
Surplus, 3li. 14s. 4½d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Petr. Lee, Hostillarii, 1523-4. (Pars Supprioris).
DIV2.P: Total receipts, 206li. 6s. 2½d.

Expenses include, 2 butt Rumnay cum portac. et car., 66s. 8d.; in vino empt. diversis vicibus pro multitudine adveniencium tempore gwerre, et Justiciariis et aliis extraneis hospitibus, 10li. 13½d.; pro cirpis, ciphis, ollis luteis, scutellis et spatulis, ac pro 6 cathedris pro cameris, 7s. 9d.; and other things much as before.

Reparaciones include work circa Aulam Hospitalem ac in stabulis hostillarii et hospecii; 87 petr. plumbi empt. de Bursario ad 4d. unde 50 petr. pro aquaductu in orto Aule hospicii et 24 petr. expend. in domo Will'i Johnson tinctoris, et pro operacione 7 rud. pro aquaductu, et pro opere 24 petr. in domo Will'i Johnson in 2 magnis le dyingledes, et pro una sisterna plumbea. Et pro vitria∣cione 24 ped. in novo opere, unde 16 ped. in interiori Camera Regis et in Aula Hospitali; et in reparacione et emendacione fenestrarum in Aula et diversis cameris.
14li. 2s. 0½d.
Total exp., 214li. 11s. 5d. Surplus, 8li. 5s. 2½d.
Vast. Include, de venello ducente ad Smythrwgh.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Cristof. Blunt, Hostilarii, 1528-9.
DIV2.P: Remanencia. Nulla, quia in superplus ult' comp' ut patet in pede ejusdem.
Redd. Assis. Rents for 15 properties and one for fuel.
Decime. Entries relating to 16 different sources of tithe, including fishery of Lumley, coals of Broom, etc.

Varia Recepta. 14li. 10s. 6d. de alteragia et sessione quadragesimali Eccl. S. Oswaldi; 21li. 19s. 10d. de proficuis et exitibus capelle S. Margarete; 58li. 9s. 3d. de prof. et exit. manerii de Elwett ut patet per compotum prepositi (and smaller sums, e.g., 10s. de altaragio parci (?) de Shynkclyff, close called Lytildedryght, rent hennes de Shynkclyff, mill of Shynkclyffe, prato voc. Hostillermedow, Hylcrukes, Welbankes).
Total Rec., 195li. 9s. 7½d.
Superplus, etc., ult. comp., 9li. 18s. 8½d.
Redd. Resol. To the abbot of Blanchland from a tene∣ment by Elvet Bridge, 15s.; to the chaplain of B.M. in the church of St. Nicholas from two tenements, 9s.

Expense Necessarie. Procurator. Eccl. S. Osw., 23s. 11d.; procurator. capelle S. Marg., 11s. 6½d.: pro 2 hoggyshedes vini rubei ad 30s., 60s.; pro portacione et cariacione ejusdem, Ultra portam Tyne, 1512-3 (and similarly in other rolls). 2s. 8d.; 2 ad 35s., 70s.; 6 ad 30s., 9li.; pro portacione et cariacione, 7s.; in vino malwaset et claret empt. in villa diversis vicibus pro Justiciar' d'ni Regis, d'no Episcopo, et aliis extraneis ac hospitibus, 20s.; in pietancia data hospitibus et aliis, 13s. 4d.; id. in primo die Rogacionum, 22s.; in vino dato in eodem die, 16s. 8d.; in vino dato noviciis, 3s. 4d.; pro sirpis (et) ciphis empt., 3s. 4d.; in ferrura equorum et seccione, 8s. 4d.; pro singulis, hedelstilles, et aliis necessariis, 5s.; pro brydil∣bittis, warnyshyng, stirroppes et aliis, 2s.; 8 plaustr. carbonum empt. pro Aula Hospicii et cameris, 12s.; pro candelis albis, 23s.; pro garniamentis serviencium, viz. Senescallo Curie de Elwett, 10s.; valecto seu custodi de le napre Hospecii, 6s. 8d.; forestario de Elwett, 6s. 8d.; et prepositi manerii de Elwett, 6s. 8d.; una cum tribus garniamentis gromorum, viz. gromo Aule Hospicii, 5s.; stabularii sive sumptuarii, 5s., et avenarii, 5s., 45s.; pro 400 ledenalles ad 4d., 16d.; pro seris et clavibus, 2s.; pro 300 burdnalles ad 5d., 15d.; 100 spykyngs, 10d.; 5000
latbrodes, ad 2s. 6d., 12s. 6d., 14s. 7d.; expens. servien∣cium equitancium negociis, 16d.; in pergameno, papiro, et scribenti, 4s.

Dona et Exennia. Et in 4 ludis d'ni Prioris, 40s.; et in vino dato in eisdem, 36s. 8d.; et cantoribus ad ludum suum ex curilietate, 3s. 4d. Et clerico infirmarii, 3s. 4d.; et in donis datis servientibus ad festum Natalis D'ni, 13s. 6d.; do. diversis in elimosina, 3s.

Pensiones. Vicario S. Osw., 16li.; Capellano S. Marg., 106s. 8d.; Magro Inf. 35s. 4d. de antiqua pens., 26s. 8d. de nova pens. et 10d. pro uno tenemento in manu Hostillar', 62s. 10d.; procurator. eccl. S. Osw., 24s.; procur. capelle S. Marg., 14s. 8d.; custodi le napre, 26s. 8d.; avenario, 4s., gromo Aule, 10s.; hospicii stabulario 13s. 4d. et custodi claustri 20d., 29s.; lotrici cum smigmate, 5s.; capellano cantarie B.M. in eccl. S. Osw. pro domo principali quondam Willmi Alnam, 19d.; eidem pro domo, 3s.; bursario pro domo 6s. 8d. cum domo 6s. 8d., 13d. 4d.; eidem pro quadam annua pensione, 7li.; magro Infirmarii et succentori erga Natale D'ni, 4s.; cantori et scribe, 33s. 4d.; senescallo tenenti curiam pro feodo suo, 13s. 4d.; d'no Episcopo pro 1 sheyll in Wardell, 5d.; capellano S. Andree super pontem pro 2 tenementis, 3s.; forestario de Elwett pro feodo suo, 4s.; et eidem eo quod ballivus Novi Burgi pro colleccione firmarum, 6s. 8d.; rectori B.M. in Ball. Austr. pro pensione sua, 5s.; feretrario pro diversis tenem. in veteri Elwett et burgo per ordinacionem novam, 46s. 8d.; eidem pro tenemento 6s. 8d., et pro alio ten. 8s., 14s. 8d.; elemosinario pro libera firma unius ten. super australem partem cornerii de Ratonraw, 4s.

Expens. Hostillar. Hostillario quia minus recipit de camerario quam aliis confratribus ad term. 9d., 3s.; pro 2 tunicis empt. pro se et socio suo, 20s.; in una cuculla, 6s. 8d.; cum 1 par ocrearum 3s. 4d., 10s.

Falcacio et lucracio feni. Places mentioned:—Lang∣meredyk, le Allers, le Ladylez, Petmedow, Charley, Awday, Bays, Palmanclosse, Egeley, Scrabstre medow, Ryage, Dedryght, Moreclosse, in orto Claustri, Hollosfeld.
Pro agestiamento equorum; clerico scaccarii d'ni Prioris pro prebenda sua, 10s.; cursori scaccarii pro preb. sua, 13s. 4d.

Tallia et Indenture. In solucione facta preposito manerii de Elwett pro expensis factis circa husbandriam, ut patet per compotum dicti prepositi, 8li. 10s. 1½d. Et in sextulacione, trituracione, et ventulacione granorum hoc anno, 4li. 6s.; in expensis autumpnalibus, 8li. 6s.; stipend. famulorum et prepositi per tempus compoti, 116s.; in octo bobus emptis, 7li. 3s.

Expens. prebend. Pro 36 quart. avenarum empt. in foro et alibi in patria (at 2s. 6d. to 3s.), 70s. 4d.; 2 qr pisarum et fabarum ad 6s. 8d., 13s. 4d.; 72 qr aven. empt. de manerio de Elwett ad 20d., 6li.; et in solucione facta bursario pro prebenda equorum carect., 20li.

Reparaciones. Ad molend. de Shynkclyff pro factura unius cogwhelle; pro faccione unius le mylne spyndyll cum ferro et calibe; pro faccione j straner in domo Will. Atkynson, 7s. 6d.; plumber, operanti super Aulam et cameris Hospecii; Isabelle Thomson et Agn. Wodyfeld pro extraccione de le thak; plumbing, pointing, thatching, etc.
8li. 2s. 11½d.
Contribuciones. Ex imposicione d'ni Prioris in rele∣vamen officii sacriste, 10li.; feretrario in relev., etc., 20s.
11li.
Allocaciones. Mention of orrium decimale de Shynk∣clyff: domus stauri.
Expenses, 194li. 14s. 7d.
Balance in hand, 15s. 0½d.
Arr. (Rents) 7s. 3d.
Decas. (Divers burgages, some waste), 77s. 6d.
Vast. De uno burgo vasto ad introitum Vyre prope pontem de Elwett, 12d.; de venello ducente ad Smytharogh, 6d.; de diversis tenementis.
P.S.—The tithe-account in the roll of 1303, p. 113, is as follows:—

De decima de Synclif, 20li.; Veteris Dunelm., 6li.; Elveth, 66s. 8d.; Brunne, 6li.; Suthstreth, 6li.; Sunderland, 6li. 13s. 4d.; Bronn et Rylley, 6li.; Neutona, 8li.; de Capella de Croxstall, 10li. 13s. 4d.
Summa, 72li. 13s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1324-5. Compotus fratris Joh'is Fossor, Camerarii, a die translacionis Sci. . . . Mill'io ccc vicesimo quarto usque ad eundem diem . . .
DIV2.P: (Much decayed, in great part quite gone, or illegible.)
Receipts under marginal headings Redd. Ass., Eccl'ia de Dalton; Pens., but only some of the amounts, not including the total, are legible.

Expens. Lanugell.; Pannus pro stam'; Linea tela; Panni pro tribuc'; Expens. xiij noviciis; Dona et exhennia Camerar. fratribus; Dona Camerar. secularibus; Expense sartrine; Expense necessarie; Expense minute; Expense autumpnales; Contribucio; Decima Regi concessa; Ex∣pense facte de officio in negociis communibus ad relevamen scaccarii diversis vicibus; Custus domorum; Ferrura equorum; Prebenda equorum; Stipendia famulorum et garcionum; Sol. debit.; Expense facte apud Hemyngburgh, Hundesley . . . Item in ordinac. fratribus delib. . . . compot. annexa.

The above are all the heads; the particulars of some only can be read. Those relating to the novices here follow in full, except that some of the prices have partly gone, and Item pro and other needless words are omitted.

Expens. xiij noviciorum. In primis pro vxx et viij ulnis panni de Berm' pro ix robis (et) iiijor cucullis, 118s., et tonsura ejusdem panni. It. pro vj frissonibus pro iiijor frokis ad iiijor novic., 15s. 6d.; 26 pellic. ad dictos novicios unacum ligaturis, 70s. 9d.; 13 pectinibus et eorum casis, 5d.; cervicalibus eisdem empt., 2s. 6d.; cuidam mulieri cooperientis cervicalia, 3d.; pro furura 13 cooperturarum empt., 24s.; vxx iiijor uln. panni pro lanugells et pro cooperturis, 105s. 9d.; pro 13 fururis pro caputiis noviciorum, 9s. 6d.; vxx xv uln. et di. de linea tela pro femoralibus, sudariis, et coopertura cervicalium,
28s.; viij uln. panni pro capuciis cum denigracione et tonsione ejusdem, 7s.; in xviij pec. stam. empt. pro stamin. xiij novic., videl. xxvj stam., 36s.; in 26 paribus sotularium cum sagimine et oleo, 31s. . . 11 uln. di. pro feltacione botarum in festo Omnium Sanctorum, 7s. 2d.; pro 13 cultellis empt. pro dictis noviciis, 2s. 11d.; pro corrigiis ad dictos cultellos pendend., 3d.; pro 24 uln. panni pro 65 pedulibus, cuilibet 5 paria . . .; pro 13 cingulis emptis, 16d.; pro 12 uln. panni pro tribucis, 7s.; ij operariis operantibus per vj dies circa vestimenta noviciorum pro servicio et potu, 22s.; sutori pro candelis, 1d.
Summa (perishea).

Dona et exhennia Camerar. fratribus. A very long list; the amounts mostly perished. Items here condensed. To Prior "ludenti" at Beurepayr about St. James's Day, 20s.; also elsewhere about St. Dunstan's Day, 13s.; to Supprior "ludenti" at Witton about Inv. Holy Cross, 4s.; to the same before Easter; spices to novices; wine in solar at Martinmas; exennium to Prior at Beaurepayr at feast of St. Dunstan; to Dan W. de Stapilton going to Staun∣ford; to R. de Halyden likewise; to Joh. de Birkir "subvenienti ad festum sim'"; Dan Tho. de Hertilpoll visiting friends; Dan R. de Kingeston, do.; to Master of Jarw, 1 piece of stamine price . .; Masters of Wermuth and Farn, and prior of Coldingham, each the same; to Ric. of Tynemuth "xj uln. panni pro manicis"; priori de Lythum 1 piece of stamine; John de Berchow ½ ell and ¼ "pro manicis"; noviciis in pai in minucione, 12d.; to Stephen de Houeden and the Supprior, Richard de Whitfield, Peter de Kelaw, Hugh de . . "et priori de Coldingham, vj paria socetes prec. . . Joh. de Goldes∣burgh, Willelmo de Gysburn juniori, Tho. de Hertilpoll, et Rob. de Bamburgh, iiijor paria pedulium prec. 12d.; Priori de Lythum, Suppriori, Joh'i de Hert, ij uln. panni prec. 13d. It. W. de Hexham, . . It. R. de Kellaw propter spoliacionem suam ex precepto prioris in pecunia. It. ij uln. di. pro lanugell prec. 2s. 6d. It. eidem iij ulne linee tele pro femoralibus pr., 9d.; It. unum sudarium prec. 3¾d.; It. j stam. et unum par soccorum, pr. 19d.; d'no Priori circa festum Sci. Jacobi apud Beaurepayr in uno exhennio, 2s. 2d.; It. alias circa idem festum in Infirmario pro j lagena vini, 6d.; It. alias ibidem circa festum Sci. Oswaldi in una lagena vini, 6d.; It. noviciis in eorum minucione ante Pascha, 8d.; Magistro de Jarw 2½ uln. de panno pro stam., 7d.; Priori Insule Sacre una pec.
stam. pr. 2s.; Joh. de Birchow vicario Camerarii, 2s.; noviciis 13 paria cyrothecarum pr. 20d.; W. de Derlington, Ric. de Tynemuth, et Will. de Aslakby quando fuerunt ordinati sacerdotes, ex precepto prioris, 10s. et tunicas."

Dona camerarii secularibus. In oblacionibus ad Natale D'ni, 2s.; to 3 men each a stamine pr. 16d.; to 2 others, blankets; Thome clerico Prioris, 3 ulne albi panni; operantibus in stagno molend., 6d.; latimis operantibus circa fenestram ecclesie, 12d.; hominibus Regis ne tollerent stramen de grangia de Morton, nec dampnum inferre officio . . . latomis et carpentariis apud Beaurepayr; in speciebus, caligis, cultellis, et cyrothecis diversis vicibus emp. et pro utilitate officii hominibus diversis collatis, 25s.

Expense Sartrine. 2 celdr. carb., 2s. 6d.; repar. del buket de fonte, 4d.; in uno tripode, 12d.; 8 libr. sepi, 10d.; 1 quart olei, 4d.; 3 lib. sagiminis, 7½d.; in oleo et sagimine, 22d.; pro denigracione ixxx uln. panni de Berm'ham et panni pro tunicis, 15s. 8d.; pro tonsura ejusdem, 12d.

Expense necessarie. In uno palefrido; in uno strigili; in j capistro et j freno, 11d.; in serura unius ciste, 3d.; in 13 boll pro pedibus fratrum lavand., 18d.; in reparacione braciarum et phalerarum, 9d.; in rep. cacabi sartrine, 3d.; in computatoriis emptis, 10d.; in tanninacione duarum pellium bovinarum, 3s.; in j serura pro hostio stabuli, 3d.; in candelis empt. in hyeme, 4d.; in supercingulis et sagimine pro equis, 10d.; in herba pro equis, 2s. 5d.; in j flasket pro palefrid., 18d.; in 13 uln. de canab. delibe∣ratis pro velo ecclesie de Dalton, 3s. 9½d.; in panno de canabo ad portand. pannos fratrum ad lavand., 3¼d.; j sella pro camerario, 6s. 8d.; in frenis, cingulis, et repar. sellarum, 2s. 5d.; in canabo ad j saccum pro prebenda equorum portanda, 5½d.; in pergameno, 6d.; in 6 ligaturis ferri ad fenestras stabul., 8d.; in expens. circa infuneracionem magistri Joh'is de Insula apud Hertilpoll, 8d.

Expense minute. Chiefly journey-money to messen∣gers going to various places to collect rent or tithe, or buy goods; cuidam eunti Ebor. pro solucione viridis cere, 22d.; in reparacione unius cuve in sartrina in qua lavantur fratres, 5d.; in itinere versus Caverham ad infuneracionem d'ni de Scrope, 4s.
Expense Autumpnales. For mowing, getting, and leading hay at Hett, and at Ketton.
Contribucio. In contribucione facta d'no Ep'o pro temporalibus ubique, 62s. 11d.; pro ecclesia de Dalton, 35s. 6¾d.
Decima Regi concessa. In primis pro temporalibus ubique, 47s. 7½d.; pro ecclesia de Dalton, 26s. 8d.; pro decima pensionum de Brantingham et Hemingburgh, 20s.; de Walkington, 8s.; de Welton, 4s.

Expense facte de officio in negociis communibus ad relevamen scaccarii diversis vicibus. In primis circa festum Sci. Luce Evangeliste apud Ebor. per octo dies et in itinere, 22s.; Item alias circa f. Omn. Sanctorum ad respondend. d'no Ep'o et Galfrido de Scroppe pro literis capitulo directis . . Item alias legitima vice, videlicet circa fest. Sci. Andr. et circa f. beati Gregorii pape pro carta de fa . . confirmacione cartarum et pro justiciariis itinerantibus de foresta, 20s.; Item apud Novum Castrum bina vice, viz. in Cathedra Sci. Petri et in Oct. Sci. Joh. Bapt., 6s.; Item pro viridi cera sicut patet per tall., 33s. Item ballivis de Eboraco pro dilacione prius habita per vices, 6s. 6d.; Item hominibus de Brakiholme in contribucione facta ball. de Ebor. pro viridi cera, 2s. 6d.

Custus domorum. In primis pro cc et xvj travis straminis empt. ad grangiam de Morton cooperiend., 18s.; de quibus c fuerunt quasi vastate per d'nm de Wake. It. carpentatoribus operant. ibidem . . pro Mccc di. clavis, 19d.; pro lattis . . preparanti fundamentum murorum dicte grangie duobus diebus . . factis viz. pro ix rod., 6s. 9d.; in potu empt. per vices . . pro virgis et adquisicione virgarum, 16d.; cuidam operario operanti . . in coopertura dicte grangie, 7s. 6d.; carpent. operantibus circa porticum ante hostium camere camerarii . . pro cariacione lapidum, 3s. 9d.; pro lapidibus et opere sklatorii . . pro cccc de spikinges, 11d.; pro plumbo . . pro calce, 8d.; pro x tabulis pro hostio et aliis necess. . . in ij ligatur. emp. ad dictum hostium, 10d. pro serura et aliis pertinentibus ad . . in ix rod. muri factis circa curiam de Dalton, 7s. 6d. preter . . in parvo muro juxta grangiam de Morton, 6d.; in potu operantis . . in emendacione molendini ventricii de Hemyngburgh sicut patet in compoto receptoris . . in reparacione molendini ventricii de Hundes∣ley . .
Ferrura equorum. A Transl. S. Tho. Mart. ad Natal. D'ni; a Natal. ad Annunc. B.M., in capistris et cingulis equorum, in ferrura a dicta Annunc. ad Transl. S. Thome.

Prebend. equorum. A Transl. S. Tho. Mart. ad fest. S. Martini in hyeme; aven. et pis. empt. per diversas vices; a f. S. Mart. usque ad Pascha in pis. aven. et fabis . . . a Pasch. usque ad Pentec. in prebenda empt. . . a Pent. usque ad Transl. predictam in . .

Stipend. famulorum et garcionum. 12 of them, mostly mentioned by name, but including these descriptions:—receptori, senescallo, sutori, pellipario, lotrici sartrine, 2 garcionibus camerarii, eisdem pro sotularibus et . . eisdem ex insufficiencia liberacionum . . (sums perished).
Sol. debit. It. d'no Thome de Graystanes pro sotul. Pasch. . . .

Expense Camerarii facte apud Hemyngburgh et Hundesley. Circa festum Translacionis Sci. . . apud Dalton circa benediccionem decimarum in festo . . . in carnibus et piscibus et aliis necessariis . . . circa fest. Sci. Dyonisii in pane cerevisia . . .
It. in ordinat. fratribus deliberat. . . Compot. annexa.

DIV2.HEAD: 1342-3. Racio administracionis facte . . . cccmo quadra∣gesimo secundo usque diem . . . videlicet per unum annum integrum et undeci . . .
DIV2.P: In a much decayed condition; the sources of receipts can be ascertained only to a small extent.
Summa, 124li. 18s. 9½d.
Cum arr. et rem. (perished).

Expens. The account of expenses is also partly decayed. It includes 47 ells de Bermegeham, newly bought cloth (panni), expend. in cucullis et froccis monachorum, cum tinctura cucullarum . . calium eorun∣dem; 15½ and 11 ells russet; 70 ells blanket; 46 pec. stamini et j stamyn de rem.; 150 ells linee tele, 7½ ells canabi, 10 ells canabi pro manutergiis et . . pannorum et huciis equorum; 3 tunics for Prior, Chamberlain, and his fellow, 24s.; in iij furrur. de buggy pro pellicio et tunica Prioris, ij furrur. agnin. pro camerario et socio suo et fururur' capu . .; in xxiij pellibus agninis et vj pellibus multonum et j coopertorio, et j petr. et ij lb. butir et calcis de rem. expend. . . pellibus agninis et multonum, et v modiis frumenti, calce, butiro, et coreo pro pellic. ligand., 35s.; in robis . . unius garcionis et unius pagii, 30s. 6d.; in ij pellibus alute et j pari sotularium de aluta, iiijor paribus sotularium de bazan, iiij paribus semell; xiiij pelli . . viij
pellibus de corvays, ij petr. et di. feodi coquine, ij coria semell, oleo, sagimine, pro eisdem correandis . . ij paribus botarum pro Camerario, 5s.; in obl. ejusdem, quia nichil recepit de feretro, 6s. 8d.; in una capa pro Camerario, 13s. 4d.; fratribus in rebus ordinatis et pecunia preter ea que supraponuntur, 48li. 6s. 8d.
Summa, 76li. 3s. 10½d.

Item computat in solucionibus debitorum, 46s. 8d.; in contribucionibus factis d'no . . Regi, Cardinalibus, et Scottis infra aquas et extra, 7li. 9s. 10d.; in condonacioni∣bus factis tenentibus in Hundesley, solucione viridis cere, et in expensis factis pro eisdem tenentibus et parochianis ementibus decimas ecclesie de Dalton, 32s. 6d.; in expens. camerarii apud Hemyngburgh, Hundesley et Dalton per tempus compoti, 73s. 7¾d.; in donis, exenniis, et curiali∣tate facta d'nis . . Priori et ludentibus apud Beaurepaire, fratribus commorantibus Oxon. et Staunford, et fratribus de claustro visitantibus amicos, 69s. 2½d. Exp. Will. de Cardoill apud Hemyngburgh et Hundesley per quinque vices, et expens. duorum garcionum euncium cum ij equis apud nundinas de Rypon et Derlington per tres vices, 36s. 1¾d.; in marescalcia, prebenda, et herba, j equo summario empto, ij sellis pro palefridis et summariis . . cum 3s. 9d. de bondis de Heworth, et 4s. 0½d. in iiij quart. prebende in statu dimissis, 6li. 14s.; in edificacione duarum domorum apud Morton et edif. cujusdam domuncule pro pellipar., reparacione fontis sartrine, emendacione domorum ejusdem, cum quinque hostiis de novo factis, seris, ferris pro fenestris, ij cistis de quatuor stagiis de novo factis in Camera, et aliis utensilibus pro diversis officiis sufficienter reparatis, cum meremio et bordis de Estland, et cum cariagio ad loca predicta 13 petr. de ferr. rem. expend., 9li. 18s. 11d.; in pens. salar. et stipend. vicarii de Dalton, senescalli de Hemyngburgh, et famulorum in sartrina, cum oblacionibus et curialitate facta eisdem ad Natale D'ni, 6li. 11s. 10d.; in falcacione, levacione, et cariagio feni de Hildecrok, cum cariag. 17 quart. frumenti de Dalton usque Dunolm. pro Scottis, 22s. 8d.; in minutis expensis necessariis per tempus compoti, 28s. 6d.; scriptori compoti et alia necessaria, 3s.; in elemosina, 3s. 11d.
Summa, 46li. 8s. 10d.
Summa omnium expens., 122li. 12s. 8½d. Excess of receipts, 145li. 21¼d. et di. ¼.
Debita que debentur officio. Amounts mostly perished, and Summa blank.

Subscripta bona remanent in officio Camerarii. In primis, j palefr. pr. 66s. 8d.; j summar. de novo empt. et non appreciatus; vxx ulne de albo Bermegeham pr. 70s.; 71½ uln. russet, 33s. 4d.; j pannus integer de virid. cordele (?) 40s. 8d.; 78 uln. blanket, 30s. 3d.; 7½ uln. de nigro panno, 3s. 1d.; 4 uln. de nigro panno, 4s.; 48 pec. stamyn, 64s.; 220 uln. linee tele, 52s. 4d.; 20 uln. canab. in manutergiis et 9 uln. in j canab. pro pannis mensurandis, 4s. 9d.; 7 furrur. emp. apud Novum Castrum, 7s. 2d.; 4 furrur. pro coopertoriis, 23½d.; ciiijxx xiiij pell. agnin. et multonum, 30s.; butir rem., 17d.; calc. rem., 8d.; di. petr. feod. coquine, 4½d.; 23 pelles alute non parate et 2 pelles alute parate, et j par botarum de aluta, 23s. 10d.; 4 duoden. et 4 pelles de baszan, 12 paria semell., 28s.; 4 zone et 3 pectinibus pro noviciis, 4d.; 5 celdr. carbon. marin., 4s.
Appended is a small strip sewn on, containing a list of arrears of rent.

DIV2.HEAD: 1343. A similar list of arrears on a separate slip.

1344-5. Racio administracionis facte in officio Camerarii Dunelm. a dominica in Ramis Palmarum Anno D'ni millesimo cccmo quadragesimo quarto usque ad eundem diem anno revoluto, liberat. D'no priori per fratrem Johannem de Hertilpoll, Camerarium.
DIV2.P: Recept. Idem respondet de 34li. 3s. 9d. qa et di. qa super diversis rebus remanentibus in officio post ultimum compotum. Et de 69li. 15s. 11d. qa et di. qa de quodam cirograffo dimisso super compotum d'ni Willelmi de Charleton; 12li. 4d. de arr. dimiss. super compotum d'ni Thome de Graistanes de anno D'ni, etc., '42; 15s. 9d. de arr. decime de Caldhesilden de anno D'ni, etc., '41; 17½d. de soulsilver de officio Bursarie de anno D'ni, etc., '42; 15s. 3½d. pro ccc travis straminis venditis et liberatis servient. Manerii de Dalton; 6li. 13s. 4d. debitis de pens. de Brantyngham de anno D'ni, etc., '42; et de 20li. 15s. 10½d. et di. qa de arr. content. in cirograffo anno D'ni, etc., '43, super compotum.
Summa arr. et remanencium, 145li. 21d. qa di. qa.

Et de 61li. 7s. 1½d. recept. de firmis redditus assise pertinentis ad officium per tempus compoti; 14li. 13s. 4d. rec. de pens. in comitatu Ebor.; 42li. 13s. 4d. rec. de decim.
parochie de Dalton vendit. de anno D'ni, etc. '43; et de 10s. 1½d. de var. recept., cum decem boll avene que vocatur Scathaver de bondis de Heworth.
Summa, 121li. 13s. 11d.
Summa tocius recept. cum arr. et remanent., 266li. 15s. 8d. qa di. qa.

Idem computat (account similar to that of 1342-3; in addition to things mentioned there, we find) de duobus pannis de worset' empt' et expend. in cucullis et froccis monachorum cum tinctura cucullarum, froccorum, capu∣ciorum noviciorum, et reparacione cervicalium eorundem; 147 uln. blanket . . expend. in laneis tribuciis et pedulibus, 4li. 19s. 1d.; in speciebus emp. pro d'no Priore et officio, et in cultellis pro d'no Priore, et in zonis, cultellis, et pectinibus de remanent. et de novo emptis, et in cultellis cirotecis et caligis emptis et expenditis in officio, 20s. 10d.; et in tribus raseriis frumenti, et in butiro et calce et coriis mutilium pro pelliciis ligandis; 33 pellibus de bazan (etc.).
Summa, 86li. 10s. 7d.
Idem computat in expensis factis circa ecclesiam de Dalton in vestimentis, libris, velis, et aliis necessariis, 17s. (a similar account to the last).
Summa, 73li. 15s. 3¾d.
Subscripta bona remanent in officio. (Partly decayed away; but the account is similar to the last).
In dorso. Debita que debentur officio.

DIV2.HEAD: 1345. Two rolls too much decayed to handle.
1346-7. Racio, etc. Joh. de Hertilpoll. (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. (cum rem., etc.). 200li. 19s. 0½d.
Exp. Much as before, e.g., in decem pelliciis et 14 pellibus multilinis et agninis cum frumento, butiro, calce, et corriis pro pellicibus ligandis.
Summa, 73li. 10s. 5½d.
Idem computat . . . pro cariagio linee tele de Thorne∣ton in ye strete usque Dunelm.

DIV2.HEAD: 1347-8. Racio, etc., per eundem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 200li. 66s. 8½d.
Exp. In . . pellibus . . cum frumento, sale, bittiro, calce, et coriis pro pellicibus ligandis; 52 pellibus de bazan; in zonis, cultellis, pectinibus, et zonis pro femora∣libus noviciorum, etc.
Summa, 90li. 12s. 10¾d.
Idem comp. . . in coopertura camere feni; repar. omnium domorum in sartrina; in pictura camere caritatis etc.
Summa, 60li. 9s. 4¼d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1348-9. Racio, etc., per eundem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Both much decayed; not examined.

DIV2.HEAD: 1349-50. Racio, etc., per Joh'm de Tykhill.
DIV2.P: Summa totius rec. (blank).
Exp., etc. Much as above.

DIV2.HEAD: 1350 (Mart. term). Racio, etc., per . . Thikhill.
DIV2.P: Rec. 104li. 11s. 5½d.
Exp. In 11 pannis de nigro worseto . . preter 2 frokkes; pellibus agn., multon., cum frumento, sale, bittiro, et coreis pro pellicibus ligandis, etc.

DIV2.HEAD: 1350-51. Racio, etc., per eundem.
DIV2.P: Rec. An account with particulars, but somewhat decayed.
Summa, etc., 127li. 2s. 9d.

Exp. In 30 par. botarum pro noviciis, cum oleo, sagimine, et 2 pell. de cordewan pro d'no Priori, 41s. 6d.; in 20 ulnis canabi empt. pro manutergiis in claustro et ad ministrand. in officio apud Dalton, 7s. 6d.; Succentori et magistro Infirmarie pro pitancia sua, 4s.; in uno palefrido empto, 100s.; in j batell' empt. pro passagio de Derwent, 26s. 8d.
Summa omn. exp., 84li. 3s. 10d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1351-2. Racio, etc., per fratrem (illegible).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 137li. 18s. 11½d.
Exp., etc. 175li. 3s. 11¾d.
This roll is in a bad state.

DIV2.HEAD: 1352. A much decayed and faded roll, and with it two little rolls of rents, waste, and arrears.
1353-4. Racio, etc., per fr. Joh. de Tykill (much decayed).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 148li. 14s. . .

Exp. In iiijxx ulnis blanket pro langels; 13 uln. canab. empt. pro manutergiis in claustro et sawnapes apud Dalton; in potu et soulsilver famulorum; in 2 libr. cere pro eccl. de Merington et cera empt. pro sigill. cum cultellis, serotecis, et speciebus empt. de datis supervenien∣tibus per temp. compoti, 11s., etc.
Summa, 106li. 16s. 10¾d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1354-5. Racio, etc., per eundem.
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 152li. 16s. 4d.
Exp., etc. 108li. 16s. 2d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1355-6. Racio, etc. (name gone; roll much decayed).
1356-7. Racio, etc. (as above).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 151li. 16s. 4¾d.
Exp. In ij lb. cere emp. pro ecclesia de Meryngton ex consuetudine, 16d.; (a lawsuit, 8li. 3s. 10d.). Item ex gracia Prioris ad fabricam fenestre in fine ecclesie, 20li.
Summa, 104li. 10s. 9¾d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1357-8. Racio, etc., per eundem (cum dupl. et parte tertii).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 141li. 1¼d.
Exp. . . In contrib. facta Cardinalibus de duobus terminis, 66s. 11d.; et fabrice ecclesie fenestr. ex gracia d'ni Prioris et conventus, 10li.; ep'o de Armah, 6s. 8d., etc.
Summa, 102li. 2s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1358-9. Racio, etc., per eundem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 143li. 9s.
Exp. In 21 par. botarum empt. pro noviciis (a) Johanne de Whitrigges Camerario . . Et Justiciariis sedentibus in com. Ebor. super scaccariam ut essent favorabiles tenentibus d'ni Prioris, 20s.
Summa, 103li. 12s. 5¼d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1360-70 (so dated on wrapper; in very bad state, head gone).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 161li. 15s. 11d.
Exp. under various heads, viz.,

Exp. panni linei, lanee, et stamin. Lane tele pro langell'; blanket pro pedulibus; 4li. nigri fili et 5li. albi fili, prec. albi fili 15d. et nigri . . ; in suicione 16 duodena∣rum femoralium pro conventu, etc.
Summa, 25li. 6s. 7d.

Exp. Noviciorum. In 10 pannis et di. nigri worseti pro 9 noviciis; 18 par. botarum, quarum 9 lineatis et 9 non lineatis pro 9 noviciis; 9 pellicibus; Joh. de Qwitrig pro rebus suis ordinatis; in una cuculla pro magistro de Farne; in lecto pro R. Constabille.
Summa, 8li. 4s. 2d.

Pensiones. Priori et fratribus pro rebus suis ordinatis pro 4 terminis, 37li. 14s. . . in j pare de trenchours pro Priore, 12s.; vicario de Dalton, 40s.; 2li. cere pro eccl. de Meryngton, 8d.(?); Succentori et magistro Infirmar., 4s. . Joh'i de Bentlay de tempore J. Abel, burs., quia noluit sibi dare pensionem, 20s.
Summa, 41li. 8s. 10d.
Salar. cum Robis. Robes for cissor, pelliparius, seneschal, and other servants; expenses in getting rents, stipends of cissor, pelliparius, and lotrix; et preposito de Hemingbourough pro labore.
Summa, 7li. 19s. 8d.
Exennia et donaciones. In 4 exenniis d'no Priori, in vino dat. in refectorio, et in salar. et muneratis (?) in convo∣cacione Justiciarum et aliorum extraneorum, in expens. fratrum apud Dalton, etc.
Summa, 7li. 7s. 4d.

Dona. Cuidam novicio celebranti primam missam; cantatoribus ante Natale; journeys to Northumberland, Holy Island, and Lythome; Episcopo Elemosinar.; to one
returning de Curia Romana; laboranti in via aquatica apud Beurepair; studenti Oxonie; in diversis donis in com. Ebor., et abbati Sci. Albani ex precepto prioris, etc.
Summa, 53s. 8d.

Minut. exp. et necessar. In cooperacione cellularum de Dalton cum stramine empt.; in coop. magne grangie et coquine apud Dalton cum sclatstan; j summario; j equo pro dec. de Dalton colligendis; in feno; cibagio et mare∣schallia; in j houce et j pectine pro equis; in 6 meles pro noviciis, cum percameno; j pelvis cum ij chargeours pro camera de Dalton; falcacio; candele et carbones; ij carris emptis pro decimis de Dalton cariandis; exp. serviencium Camerarii versus nundinas de Rypon, Treske, et Alverton, pro panno lineo emend.; pro labore apud Rypon', et pro sculptura pannorum proveniencium; in blechynges pannis linei, viz. c et x uln.; ferrura equorum; emend. sell., etc.; repar. murorum circa manerium de Dalton; servient. sartrine pro soulsilver quia liberacio eorum minus sufficiens; d'no de Cottingham pro supportacione tenent. ville de Hundesley; scribenti comp.; in 4 quart et di. (blank) emp. et dat. granetario pro pane ab eo recept.; in exp. pro dec. parochie de Dalton colligendis.
Summa, 16li. 8s. 8d.
Expens. Camerar. In 2 tunicis pro Camerario et socio suo; j sella cum freno pro Camerario; Camerario quia nichil percipit de feretro; 3 par. botarum pro Camerario; Vicario Camerarii in ecclesia.
Summa, 60s.
Summa, 7li. 12s. 4d.
Summa omn. exp., 120li. 23d.
[Next before 1362-3 came d'ns Adam de Derlington: see his debts in that account].

DIV2.HEAD: 1362-3. Racio, etc. (name gone).
DIV2.P: Arr. Nulla, quia primus compotus dicti fratris Willelmi, etc.

Reddit. assis. cum pens. et decimis. Idem resp. de 20li. 12s. 2d. de redd. ass. vill. de Hemyngburgh et Brake(nholme); 26s. 4¾d. de operibus autumpnalibus ad idem festum; 11s. 3d. de gallin. de redd. ad idem festum; 8li. 22½d. de redd. ass. vill. de Hundesle et Drewton ad eundem . . 4s. de uno ten. et 25 acr. terre ad eundem terminum. Et non
plus quia d'ns Adam de Der(lington) recepit decimam feni ibidem ante decessum suum, que solebat dimitti cum predictis ten. et terra ut in comp. precedente; de herbag. montis gardini de Dalton, nil, eadem causa; 9d. de firma camere super portam ad eund. term.; 26li. 13s. 4d. de dec. garb. tocius paroch. de Dalton vendit. per predict. d'nm Adam; 7li. 6s. 8d. de pension. ecclesiar. in comit. Ebor. ad e. t.; 13s. 3d. de Communiario pro terra in Het ad e. t.; 9d. de quodam mesuagio in villa Sci. Botulphi ad e. t.; 21s. 5d. de scaccario Prioris pro soulsilver servientibus sartrine debita; nil de x boll avenarum de r. vill. de Overheworth, quia predictus d'ns Adam recepit ante decessum suum ut supra; 23s. r. de 15 coreis bovium venditis, recept. de Cellerario; et nil de columbario de Dalton in denariis, quia in manibus Camerarii; et nil de finibus et amercia∣mentis curie de Hemyngburgh, quia prepositus nondum inde computavit.
Summa, 67li. 13s. 10¼d.

Forinc. recept. De 9li. 6s. 3½d. rec. ut in panno invento in officio post decessum dicti d'ni Ade particulariter appreciato et recepto per indentur.; 42li. 3s. 7½d. de arr. ult. comp. dicti d'ni Ade per quandam cedulam indent. parcell. continentem; 8s. de d'no Will. Vavasour debitis dicto d'no Ade nuper Camerario supradicto; 13s. 4d. de firma de Drewton debit. eidem d'no Ade per quandam cedulam.
Summa, 52li. 12s. 3d.

(Rec. ex) mutuo. 100s. de Rob. de Whalton; 13li. 6s. 8d. mutuatis ab eodem; 40s. mutuatis de d'no Ric'o de Bikirton Suppriore; 40s. mut. de d'no Ric'o de Birtele; 40s. mut. de Will'o de Crome mercatore apud Ebor.
Summa, 24li. 6s. 8d.
Summa omn. exp., 144li. 12s. 9¼d.
Exp. (Under different heads, as in 1360-70).

Panni, etc., pro conventu. In 24 braccis novis; 7 noviciis senioribus, cuilibet pro 2 par. botarum; d'no Joh'i de Whitrig pro una cuculla, 1 pell., 4 paribus pedul., 1 pari tribuc', et una tunica, 16s. 4d.; 9 panni lanei emp. pro sokkis pro predictis 7 noviciis senioribus, uln. ad 6d.; in coreo emp. pro pellic. eorundem, 18d.; in pannis lineis cusandis et fil. emp. cum suicione manutergiorum; in 12 bollis emp. pro noviciis, etc.
Summa, 16li. 14s.

Panni, etc., pro noviciis. In linea tela, worsett, 12 stamyns, 6 pellic', capuc', 6 par. botarum, 6 cultell., 6 zonis, 53 uln. blanketti pro lanugellis, 16 uln. pro tribuc. et sokkis, canevas, russet pro coopertoriis, furrur. pro eisdem emp. pro rastura 6 noviciorum, cum di. lb. nigri fili.
Summa, 10li. 4s. 1½d.
Pensiones et salaria cum robis. Much as before, but at the end, Item Cardinal' pro decima de Dalton et temporali∣bus infra aquas et dioc. Ebor. et pro expens. inde de termino Purificacionis.
Summa, 37li. 15s. 10½d.

Exennia, convocaciones, et dona. Exennia to Prior at Beaurepair and Pytingdon, 25s. 4d. ; convocacione Joh. Mowbray (and 4 others) per vices . . ; conv. fratrum apud Dalton divers vicibus, 27s. 8d.; 3 cultell. datis precept. Prioris, 6s.; cantoribus ludent. ap. Beaurep. ante Natale, 3s. 4d.; (presents of money, and wine).
Summa, 119s. 10d.
Minute expense et necessarie. Trial about Heming∣burgh fishery, 46s. 8d.; etc., much as before ; in uno pari de Rebbours (?) de novo fact. cum ligatur. eorundem, 4s. 6d.
Summa, 111s. 0½d.
Soluciones debitorum d'ni Ade de Derlington per de∣bitarium suum et extra. Sums due from dan Adam to Oxford students and 14 other persons.
Summa, 9li. 16s. 3d.
Summa, 28li. 6s. 8d.
Summa omn. Exp. cum Alloc., 114li. 7s. 9½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1363-4. Comp. Willelmi Vavasour Camerarii, etc. (Much decayed).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 192li. 8s. 7¼d.
Exp. Lawsuit, etc., connected with Howden, 31li. 19s. 10d.
Summa exp., 159li. 9s. 8¼d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1365-6. Racio, etc., per W. de Vavasor. (Three copies, all much decayed).
DIV2.P: Rec. 3s. 4d. de herbag. montis gardini de Dalton.
Summa Rec., etc., 179li. 16s. 1¾d.
Exp. Pann. lin. non dealbat. ; in j cuculla pro magistro de Farne (as usual).
Summa omn. exp., 125li. 18s. 3¼d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1366-7. Racio, etc., per eundem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 183li. 8s. 3¼d.
Exp., etc. 123li. 4s. 5d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1367-8. Racio, etc., per eundem.
DIV2.P: Rec. 120li. 16s. 8¾d.; cum arr. et mutuac., 195li. 3s. 10¾d.
Exp. In correccione botarum pro noviciis, 5s. 6d. Mro de Farne, cucull., 5s.
Dona. ij clericis escaetoris, ut essent favorabiles pro negoc. villam de Hunddesle continent . . . s. 4d.
Exp. min. In correccione sellarum, etc.
Summa omn. exp., 173li. 8s. 5½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1370-71. Ratio, etc. Joh'is Abel (the first that is not much decayed).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 135li. 4s. 11¼d.
Exp. Dona. Ep'o Elemosinar. ex dono Camerar', 2s.; in pomis et vino missis d'no Priori ludenti apud Beaurep., 3s.
Repar. Columbar. de Dalton; apud Beaurep. circa meremium pro magno orreo apud Dalton, 2s. 4d.; in vitriacione unius fenestre in choro ecclesie de Dalton, 10s.

Exp. nec. In uno dryssyngknyf et cathedra lignea empt. pro Dalton, 2s. 6d.; in uno par calcarium empt. pro Camerario, 8d.; pro una litera excommunicacionis ecclesie de Dalton, 6d.; in una corda emp. pro Corpore Xi pendente in ecclesia de Dalton, 4d.; in ligatura unius baptisterii pro ecclesia de Dalton, 8d.; in expens. Prioris apud Dalton in visitacione sua, 13s. 8d.; in recompensacione facta Elemosinario pro prandio dato servientibus Camerarii, 6s. 8d.
Summa omn. Exp., 109li. 1d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1372-3. Racio, etc., ejusdem.
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 139li. 18s. 9½d.
Exp. Cowl for Prior of Farne with Novices' expenses, as always.

In contrib. facta d'no Regi pro trecennali de t. stattuitatis (sic; statutis?) Sci. Joh. Bapt. et Pur. Beate Marie, 109s. 10d. In contrib. facta Cardinal. apud Dunelm. et Ebor., 12s. 0½d.; in contrib. facta d'no Regi apud Dunelm. et Ebor. pro 3d. ad libram et ob. Episcopo Carpatrensi, 10s. 11d. In contr. facta pro le rerdose ad magnum altare in ecclesia (de Merington), 14d.
Dona. Ep. Elem., 2s.; Magistris facientibus campanam et feretrum ex curialitate, 2s.

Exp. In melis . . empt.; in uno cribro pro calce, 3d.; in uno tankard ferro ligato, emp. pro Dalton, 3s. 4d.; in uno yettelyng eneo, do., 12d.; in cera rubea empt. pro acquietanc. sigilland., 3d.; in uno turibulo emp. pro ecclesia de Dalton, 3s.; Vicario Camerarii in ecclesia, 6s. 8d.
Summa omn. Exp., 114li. 12d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1374-5. Racio, etc., ejusdem.
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 126li. 8s. 4¼d.
Exp. In . . uln. panni lanei lati (et) stricti; panni linei stricti (et) lati; in 8½ uln. canabi empt. pro manutergiis in claustro, 3s. 6½d.

Pens. In contr. facta d'no Regi pro annali de terminis Nativ. S.J.B. et Pur. B.M.V., 109s. 10½d.; contr. pro le rerdos ad magnum altare, 22s.; contr. nunciis per d'nm papam ad partes Flandr. destinatis jd. ad libram et alias ob. ad libram, in com. Ebor. et in dioc. Dunelm. 1d. et qa ad libram et alias ob. ad libram, 5s. 7d.; in subsidio d'no Ep'o Ebor., 17s.
Salar. cum Robis. Robes for Seneschal and Pre∣positus of Hemingbrugh and others.

Dona. In una pitancia noviciis ante festum Nat. S.J.B., 2s.; Will'o Arpour (H prefixed) ad ludum apud Beaurep., 12d.; cuidam garcioni Prioris de Coldingham ducenti unum leporarium de Scocia, 12d., etc.

Rep. domor. In coopertura fontis, cum sarratura et clavis et 40 estlandburd empt. pro eadem, 17s. 2d. (apd Dalton) in cariacione meremii et inquisicione de palice, 3s. 8d.; in reparacione muri circa Paradis', 18d.
Summa omn. Exp., 110li. 19s. 10½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1377-8. Comp. fr. Joh. Beryngton.
DIV2.P: Rec. 140li. 15¾d.
Exp. novic. In duobus frokys empt., 13s. 4d.
Pensiones. Fratribus nostris Oxon. studentibus, 20s. (as frequently). D'no n'ro Regi in subsidium defensionis regni pro decima integra pro primo termino solucionis eiusdem, 105s. 10¼d.
Salar., etc. In stipendiis Ade Jolilok et Petri gar∣cionis, 15s.
Dona. Ep'o Elemos., 2s.
Summa Exp., etc., 127li. 8¼d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1378-9. Comp. ejusdem.
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 121li. 14s. 4d.
Empcio panni. In tribus roll de worset . . pro staminis faciend., 24s.
Summa Exp., 101li. 10s. 1d.

DIV2.HEAD: c. 1380. Roll s. a. Head gone; rest much decayed.
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 144li. 10s. 10d.
Exp. In canabo pro manutergiis in claustro.
Exp. novic. In pelliciis factis; iij frockes.
Dona. Ep'o Elem., 2s.

Rep. domor. Pro coopertura de novo aule officii Camerarie, 10s. In conburacione unius toralis calcis cum carbonibus pro eodem empt. apud Dalton, 20s. In cariacione molarum et reparacione earundem pro molen∣dino de Hemyngburgh, 12s.; in uno saleyerd empt. pro eodem, 3s.; in factura unius pillorii et farcarum in dominio de Hemyngburgh, 12s.; in duabus ligaturis ferreis pro rota molendini, 2s.; in reparacione unius alterius molendini equini, 9d.; pro c clavis empt. pro la louthir, 2d.
Exp. Cam. In solucione facta Vicario Camerarii in ecclesia, 6s. 8d.
Summa Exp., 122li. 17s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1379-80. Comp. ejusdem. (Much decayed).
DIV2.P: Rec. 69li. 13¼d.
Exp. (all together). In uno gown empt. pro Petro garcione, 4s.
Summa Exp., 38li. 11s. 5½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1402-3. Comp. d'ni Joh. Barton. (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 105li. 19s. 3¾d. (sine arr. et mut.).
Exp. In solucione iiijor sociis Oxon. studentibus pro eorum femoralibus, 16s.; in una pellicia; in tribus pannis de wirsted.

Rastura noviciorum. 12 entries for clothes and bedding for 6 novices who seem to have taken the tonsure together; 6 at least of everything, but 12 stamines, 12 pair of drawers, and 12 capitalia; in 2 canveys empt., 2s. 6d.; in 8 uln. de blankett pro tribul. et soccis, 5s. 4d.
Pension. In contrib. ad dormitorium, 26s. 8d.; d'no Regi, 73s. 10½d.; ad pontem, 10s.
Dona et exennia. Ep'o Elem., 2s. 6d. (secunda manu).
Exp. Cam. Vicario suo in ecclesia, 6s. 8d., et una capa, 10s.
Alloc. et condonac. In alloc. Rectori de Hemmyng∣burgh pro le Stakgarth, 2s.
Exp. necess. In frumento empt. et dat. Granatori pro pane, nil; in uno pare de trenchours pro d'no Priore, 15s. 4d. (these occur regularly).
Summa Exp., 101li. 10s.

DIV2.HEAD: 1403-4. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 116li. 9s. 5¾d.
Pens. Dormitorio, 26s. 8d.
Exp. 101li. 6s. 10¼d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1406-7. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.), much decayed.
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 119li. 16s. 3¾d.
Exp. Rastur. In 6 pannis de wirsted; in panno pro tribul' et soccis, 3s. 2d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1407-8. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 117li. 9s. . .
Exp. Pens. In 2 lib. cere pro eccl. de Meryngton ad stand. et ardend. in choro coram Sc'o Joh'e Baptista, 14d.; pro pens. Oxon. pro concordia, 30s. 8d.
Alloc. In alloc. Joh'i Ballivo de Hemmyngburgh de firmis tenencium de Hundeley et Hemmyngbourgh per ipsum levatis, propter ejus impotenciam consumptis, 40s.
Exp. 102li. 8s. 10d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1408-9. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.). Both much decayed.
DIV2.P: Rec. 28s. pro 15 coreiis bovinis de celario de electis melioribus trium slawters.
Rec. 120li. 12s. 5¾d.
Exp. 110li. 2s. 4d.

1411-2. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).

Pens. Clerico curie de Hemmingburgh, 10s.
Dona, etc. Ep'o Elem., 2s. 6d.; in expensis minuto∣rum noviciorum, 3s. 6d.; in vino minutis eisdem, 5s. 6d.
Exp. nec. In emendacione molendini ventric' de Hemmyngburgh et navicule ibidem, cum tabulis, clavis et meremio empt., 22s. 10d.
Alloc. Item petit allocari de 13s. 4d. de piscaria de Hemmyngburgh nuper destructa; et de 21s. de uno tenente in Hundeslay qui fugit ultra Humbram cum catallis et firma sua.
Exp., etc. 98li. 5s. 3¾d.

1413-4. Comp. ejusdem (cum duobus consimilibus).

Dona, etc. Ep. Elem., 2s. 6d.
Exp. 52li. 14s. 8d.

Status Dimiss. In primis duo equi, una sella monachalis, 1 somersadil, 1 hakenaysadil, 1 malesadil, 2 duodena de pewderwessell, 5 mappe cum 1 manutergio, 2 bankquer', 1 candelabrum ferreum, 1 par tabellarum mag∣narum, 1 duoden. coclear. argent., 1 plumbum magnum in sartrino, 1 plumbum parvum apud Dalton; Item 2 olle enee magne; Item rem. in precio argent. 6 panni de melioribus staminis integri, prec. 60s. 2d. Item 24 uln. panni linei precii 8s. 6d.; Item 25 uln. panni lanei boni et lati pro tunicis noviciorum, 29s.; Item 20 uln. de canevas, prec. uln. 2½d., 4s. 2d.; Item ij panni de worstede pro 2 noviciis radendis, pr. 11s. 4d.; It. j par botellarum. It. 2 pelves et 2 lavacra in manu Thome Holand.
Summa, 6li. 14d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1410-15. Two fragmentary rolls so labelled. Not exam∣ined.
1440-41. Comp. fr. Tho. Nessbytt (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. Pro xij bollez de Scathavere.
Rec., etc. 131li. 10s. 3¼d.
Exp. Pro 8 pannis de worsted nigri.
Exp. Nov. In 5 tunicis nigris pro 5 noviciis sacer∣dotibus ad 2s. 2d.
Pensiones. Senescallo de Hemmyngburgh . . et Subsenescallo . . et Ballivo ibidem . . et Receptori ibidem. Et Joh'i Stele cantori . . et homini claustr., etc.
Exp. nec. Ep'o puerili Elemos., 2s.; Vicario de Dalton propter exilitatem vicarie sue, 20s. 6½d.
Exp. 84li. 2s. 1½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1441-2. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 138li. 17¼d.
Exp. Dona, etc. Ricardo Sherburn et Thome Cave pro vectura sua versus Oxon., 10s.
Exp. nec. In reparacione molendini de Hemmyng∣burgh, viz. in spyndillyng et factura unius novi saylyerde, 3s. 8d. Ep'o puerili Elemos., 20d.
Exp. 151li. 11s. 0¼d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1442. Comp. ejusdem. May 11 to Martinmas (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 45li. 9s. 4d.
Exp. 51li. 10s. 9d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1442-3. Comp. d'ni Ric. Blakburne (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 27li. 3s.
Exp. pannor. In 1 panno nigro de worestede pro noviciis, 8s. 6d.
Exp. nec. D'no Joh. Gatesheued pro copia unius brevis in causa cujusdam felonis infra dominium de Hemmyngburgh, 12d.
Exp. 38li. 3s. 3¾d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1443-4. Comp. ejusdem.
DIV2.P: Rec. 84li. 15s. 7½d.

Exp. nec. In expensis Receptoris de Hemming∣burgh ad castrum Ebor. et alibi, cum feodis jurisperitorum conductorum pro piscaria in Ouse, et cum expensis Joh'is Gatesheued usque Ebor. pro eadem causa, . . 4d. Et in expensis computantis et aliorum infra com. Ebor., cum donis datis Willelmo Bapthorpe, uni Baronum de Scaccario d'ni Regis, ac aliis jurisperitis, circa quoddam breve vocat. Nisi prius prosecutum ad instanciam d'ni Prioris Dunelm. pro bonis cujusdam felonis infra dominium de Hemmyng∣burgh, super eundem Priorem injuriose disseisatis, 9li. Et in reparacione molendini de Hemmyngburgh, cum tabulis, clavis, et ferris emptis pro emendacione batelli ad passagium de Barnby ultra aquam de Derwent, 12s. 8d. Ep'o puerili Elem., 2s.
Exp. 82li. 14s. 11¾d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1444-5. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 89li. 17s. 11½d. Superplus, 53s. 1¼d.
Repar. In rep. molend. de Hemingburgh, cum mundacione batelli ad passagium de Barnby, 5s. 10d.
Exp. 85li. 4s. 2½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1447-8. Comp. fr. Joh. Pencher (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 83li. 8s. 2d.
Exp. Ep'o puerili Elem., 20d.

Repar. Et in repar. molendini de Hemmyngburgh, viz., in cma thakborde cum vectura ferri, ac emendacione fusill. et rote, 9s. 11d.; in repar. cujusdam fontis ex opposito le Saretree, ac unius gardini ibidem vocati Paradise, 5s. 10½d.
Summa Exp., etc., 79li. 10s. 6½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1448-9. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 84li. 9s. 4½d.
Exp. Ep'o puerili Elem., 20d.
Rep. In rep. de lez spyndillez et coggez molendini de Hemingb., 2s. 8d. j crooke pro porta de le Sartre, 12d.
Summa Exp., etc., 88li. 14s. 6½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1449-50. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Summa Rec., 82li. 2s. 4d.
Exp. Ep'o puerili Elem., 20d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1450-1. There are three copies of this roll, which, like the last two or three, are in much better condition than the earlier ones. This one is given in full, by way of specimen. All the preceding are similar to it.

Compotus fratris Johannis Pencher, Camerarii ecclesie cathedralis Dunelm. a die lune prox. post festum Ascensionis Domini Anno Domini Millesimo ccccmo quinquagesimo, usque ad diem tunc prox. post idem festum Anno Domini Millesimo ccccmo quinquagesimo primo.
DIV2.P: Rem. Rem. nulla compoti precedentis, quia in superplus' ut patet in pede ejusdem.
Summa, nulla.

Recepta. Sed respondet de xlijli. xiiijs. ixd. ob. rec. de reddit. assis. villarum de Hemmyngburgh et Braken∣holme, cum xxxs. de novo incremento ibidem. Et de xxiiijs. rec. de operibus autumpnalibus earundem villarum hoc anno. Et de xijs. vjd. rec. de gallinis rentalibus earundem villarum hoc anno. Et de xxvjs. viijd. rec. de redd. assis. ville de Drewton. Et de xjs. iijd. rec. de perquisitis Curiarum tent. apud Hemmyngburgh hoc anno. Et de cxjs. viijd. rec. de redd. assis. ville de Hundesley, una cum libero redditu quinque solidorum exeuncium de iiijor bovatis terre Rad'i Babthropp ibidem. Et de xvijli. rec. de pensionibus ecclesiarum in Com. Ebor., viz., ecclesie de Brantyngham, vjli. xiijs. iiijd.; ecclesie de Welton, xls. ecclesie de Hemmyngburgh, lxvjs. viijd.; ecclesie de Walkyngton, cs. Et de vjs. viijd. rec. de firma unius ten. in Morton hoc anno. Et de vijs. rec. pro decima feni ejusdem ville hoc anno. Et de vjs. viijd. rec. de Communiario Dunelm. pro terris in villa de Hett. Et de vs. rec. pro xij bollez de Scathaver, exeunt. de xij bondag' in villa de Overheworth, annuatim officio debitis. Et de xs. xd. rec. de Celerario Dunelm. pro soulsilver per lij septimanas, viz. pro singula septimana ijd. ob. Et de xviijs. rec. de xv corriis boum sic venditis hoc anno Johanni Henrison, barker. Et de ijs. vjd. rec. pro herbagio gardini manerii de Dalton, tamen reddere sol. per annum, iijs. iiijd. Et de viijs. rec. pro prato Camerarii in Trillesden, sic dimisso Communiario hoc anno. Et de xls. rec. pro decima garb. de Dalden, sic vend. Will'o Bowes, Chivaler. Et de lxs. rec. pro decima garb. de Hesilden, sic vend. Thome Jakeson. Et de xiijs. rec. pro decima garb. de Dalton, sic vend. Vicario ejusdem. Et de xlvjs. viijd. rec. de decima garb. de Morton, sic vend. Hugoni Jakeson.
Summa totalis Recepte, iiijxxli. vs. ijd. ob.
Superplus. In primis, Idem computat in superplus ultimi compoti precedentis, ut patet in pede ibidem, vijli. xvijs. vd. ob. qa.
Summa, patet.

Empcio pannorum. Et in denariis sol. pro viij pannis de nigro worstede, prec. panni viijs. viijd., lxixs. iiijd. Et pro vj pannis albis de worstede emp. pro staminis ad viijs. viijd., lijs. Et in xlix uln. panni lanei emp. ad iiijd., xvjs. iiijd. Et in j par tribullez emp. pro d'no Priore, viijd. Et in xxj uln. panni linei emp. infra tempus compoti ad iiijd. ob., vijs. xd. ob. Et in lxj uln. panni linei ad
iiijd. qa., xxjs. vijd. Et in cmalxviij uln. panni linei ad iiijd., lxijs. viijd. Et in xviij uln. emp. ad ijd. ob., iijs. ixd. Et in filis albis et nigris emp. infra tempus compoti, ijs. vjd. Et in suicione x dd. femoralium infra idem tempus, prec. le dd. ixd., vijs. vjd. Et in una cuculla emp. pro magistro de Farne, vs.
Summa, xijli. ixs. ijd. ob.

Expense noviciorum. Et in vj pelliceis pro noviciis infra idem tempus, xijs. Et in xij paribus botarum emp. pro eiisdem infra dictum tempus, unde vj paria ad vijs. vjd. et alia vj paria ad viijs., Meaning that one half-dozen pair came to 7s. 6d. and the other to 8s. xvs. vjd.
Summa, xxvijs. vjd.

Pensiones. Et sol. d'no Priori et confratribus pro rebus ordinatis iij term., xxxjli. viijs. xjd. Et magistro Infirmarie, ijs.; Succentori, ijs.; et cantoribus ad ludum suum, ijs.; vjs. Et in ij libr. cere emp. ad ecclesiam de Meryngton ad festum Sci. Joh'is Baptiste, xvjd. Et Senescallo de Hemmyngburgh pro feodo suo de term. Pent. et Mart. infra tempus compoti, xls. Et Subsenes∣callo pro feodo suo de eiisdem terminis, vjs. viijd. Et Ballivo ibidem pro feodo et roba suis de eiisdem t., xxs. Et Willelmo Goldesburgh, Receptori ibidem, pro feodo et roba suis de eiisdem t., xxvjs. viijd. Et Joh'i de Claustro pro feodo suo de e. t., xxd. Et Joh'i Stele cantori pro feodo suo de e. t., xiijs. iiijd. Et Vicario de Dalton pro exilitate vicarie sue hoc anno, xviijs.
Summa, xxxviijli. ijs. vijd.

Salaria cum Robis. Et in una roba empt. pro Senescallo de Hemmyngburgh hoc anno, xxs. Et homini Camerarii pro roba sua, vjs. viijd.; et eidem pro feodo suo, xs.; et eidem ex curialitate, iijs. iiijd.; et eidem pro le soulsilver pro lij sept., cap. singula sept. iiijd., xvijs. iiijd.; xxxvijs. iiijd. Et scissori pro stipendio suo hoc anno, xs.; et eidem ex curialitate, vjs. viijd.; xvjs. viijd. Et lotrici pro stipendio suo hoc anno, vjs. viijd.
Summa, iiijli. viijd.

DIV3.P: Dona et exennia. Et in iiijor exenniis datis d'no Priori, xls. Et in vino dato in ludis d'ni Prioris, xixs. iiijd. Et in uno pare del trencheours emp. pro d'no Priore, viijs.

Expense Camerarii. Et in ij tunicis cum furruris emp. pro Camerario et socio suo, xxs. Et eidem Camerario pro oblacionibus de officio feretr. sibi spectantibus, eo quod nichil recipit de Feretrario, xxs. Et eidem pro oblac. de officio Communiarie sibi spectant., eo quod nichil recepit de Communiario, xxs. Et eidem Camerario pro botis suis, vjs. Et Vicario computantis in ecclesia, vjs. viijd.

Expense necessarie. Et in colleccione firmarum et pensionum in com. Ebor. et alibi per Willelmum Goldes∣burgh et Robertum Barton servientem computantis, xixs. iijd. Et in expensis computantis versus Hemmyngburgh causa officii, vijs. Et in vij plaustratis feni emp. infra tempus compoti, xxxixs. iiijd. Et pro cariagio ij plaustrat. feni a Morton usque Dunelm Erased in one roll and not entered in another. (blank). Et in herbagio unius equi tempore estivali, iiijs. Et in prebenda equorum infra tempus compoti, vjs. Et in ferrura equorum et marescalcia, iijs. Et in una nova sella emp. pro cariagio, xiiijs. Et in reparacione sellarum cum frenis et ligaturis, ijs. ijd. Et in expensis Senescalli ad omnes Curias tentas apud Hemmyngburgh, vijs. iijd. Et in regardo dato omnibus tenentibus ibidem ex gracia domini, iijs. iiijd. Et in pergameno, papiro, cera rubea emp., et clerico scribenti hunc compotum, ijs. viijd. Et Episcopo puerili Elemosinarie, xxd. Et Receptori in Com. Ebor. pro expensis suis usque Dunelm. pro compoto suo audiendo et terminando, vjs. viijd.

Reparaciones. Et sol. Joh'i Cales operanti super unum orreum apud Dalton per vj dies, cap. pro se per diem vjd. et apprenticio suo iiijd., vs. Et in cma del spikynges emp. pro dicto orreo, xijd. Et in reparacione batelli pro passagio de Barneby hoc anno, ijs. viijd. Et in reparacione molendini ventritici de Hemmyngburgh hoc anno, iiijs. iijd.

Allocaciones. In primis, Idem computans petit alloc. de xxvjs. viijd. vastis ville de Drewton. Et de lxvijs. jd. de decas. ville de Hemmyngburgh et Brakenholme. Et de ijs. vjd. de gardino Manerii de Dalton, quia in manu d'ni pro defectu tenentis.
Summa Expens. Soluc. et Alloc., iiijxxijli. ijs. xjd. qa. Et sic superexpendit, xxxvijs. viijd. ob. qa.

Status Officii rem. super hunc Compotum. In primis in scaccario sunt vj staminea, xij femoralia, ij capitalia, iij ulne de nigro worstede, j manutergium, j par tribullez, ij par. pedul., xij cocliaria argent., iij olle enee, xiiij platers, xvij disci, viij salsaria; Item in stabulo ij selle cum ij frenis, j nova sella pro cariag., ijo equi.

DIV2.HEAD: 1452-3. Comp. Henrici Rakett.
DIV2.P: Rec. 4li. de d'no Joh. Gatesheued ex precepto d'ni Prioris hoc anno ad novam rasturam assignat.
Summa Rec., 88li. 3s.
Empcio pannorum. Pro 8 pannis et 4 uln. de nigro sago ad diversa precia, 4li. 1s.; in 10 pannis 12 uln. de sago albo pro staminis, pr. panni 9s., 4li. 13s. 4d.

Nova rastura. Et in 12 staminis, 12 femoralibus, 6 par de tribuez, 12 par pedalium, cum panno nigro pro 6 capuciis, 6 cucullis, 6 froccis, 6 tunicis nigris, 6 tunicis albis, cum 6 cucullis pro ludis tenttis eisdem, nichil, quia de stuffo superius emp. Et solvit pro 6 pelliciis 15s., una cum furruracione 6 capuciorum, 6s., 21s. Et pro 12 par botarum, 12s., 6 par lodicum 18s. 4d., 30s. 4d. Et pro 6 zonis, 6d., 6 cultellis, 6d., 6 pectinibus cum ligaminibus pro botis et aliis necessariis, 8d., 20d. Et pro 6 pannis furruratis emp. pro eisdem noviciis, 5s. Et pro deni∣gracione et tonsione panni lanei pro lectis, tunicis, et capuciis, eorundem noviciorum, 3s. 10d.
Summa, 61s. 10d.
Dona, etc. Et in una frocca data d'no Ric'o Wrake, Communiario, eo quod morabatur ad extra per 7 annos, 5s.

Exp. nec. Ep'o puerili Elem. ex consuetudine, 20d. Et in uno equo varii coloris, 26s. 8d.; d'no Joh. Greyn celebranti primam missam, 6s. 8d.; in reparacione facta in uno passu de spyndellez molendini ventritici in Hemyng∣burgh, 8d.
Summa Exp., etc., 92li. 8s. 0¾d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1453-4. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.). The initial C of the heading finely illuminated, but without use of colour.
DIV2.P: Rec. 95li. 9s. 10d.
Exp. Ep'o puerili Elem., 20d. Long entry of 11 lines about a law case, 26s. 6d.

Reparaciones. Et in reparacione facta pro batella passagii de Barneby, viz. pro duabus partibus de novo factis hoc anno, 65s. 4d.; et in factura de novo unius paris de stokes cum una thewe hoc anno, 6s. 4d.; et in repara∣cionibus factis circa molendinum ventriticum de Hemyng∣burgh, viz. pro uno novo axiltre cum ȝattynges et factur', 22s. 3½d.; et in ijbus ganges de spyndellez et cogges de novo empt., cum 8d. in una nova sera pro hostio dicti molendini, 2s. 8d.; et in uno pare molarum cum cariagio earundem ad dictum molendinum tam per aquam quam per terram, 27s. 3d.; et in dolacione earundem ad molen∣dinum, 3s. 4d.; et in iiijor petris ferri emp. pro renovacione de le spyndellez et rynd, cum factura eorundem, 8s. 6d. Et in reparacione facta apud Morton hoc anno, 3s.
Summa, 6li. 18s. 8½d.
Summa omn. exp., etc., 95li. 18s. 2¾d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1454-5. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 87li. 6s. 2½d.
Emp. pannor. This accountant mentions sagum regularly where his predecessors had Worsted.
Pensiones. The two pounds of wax go to Est∣meryngton. Joh. Steyl, cantor, goes on.

Exp. nec. Ep'o puerili Elem. ex cons., 20d. Lawsuit going on, 38s. 10d. In reduccione equorum de Insula Sacra usque Dunelm., 10d. Et in 8 planchours cum serracione et factura unius bay pro equis in stabulo Camerarii, 3s. 4d. Et in emend. unius situle, 3d.
Repar. In adquisicione unius plaustrati de le watyls pro domo Camerarii in Morton, 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1455-6. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec., etc. 90li. 10s. 2¾d.
Nova rastura. For four novices, 4 paria de tribuez.
Exp. nec. Ep'o puerili Elem., 20d.; in carbonibus et candelis emp. pro stabulo, 2d.; in emend. unius cisterne, 2d.
Repar. In reparacionibus factis circa molend. ven∣triticum de Hemingb. viz. in newe sayl clas, 14s. 7d.
Exp. 92li. 16s. 5d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1456-7. Comp. ejusdem.
DIV2.P: Rec. 4s. 6s. 8d. pro dec. garbarum ville de Calde∣hesylden (also in last two or three rolls).
Rec. 86li. 11s. 11d.
Exp. novic. 20 pair of boots for the 13 novices in one year, 10 pair at 12s. and 10 at 13s. 4d.
Exp. nec. Ep'o puerili Elem., 20d. Pro uno equo conducto de Joh. Coken versus Oxon. et ibidem pro nimio labore mortuo, 5s. 7d.
Repar. Circa molend. ventrit. de Hemingb. viz. in thakbordes, spyndyls, et spykynges, cum midilspykinges, ryndes, et cogges, cum operacione ejusdem et cariagio, 18s. 10d.
Exp. 86li. 8s. 0¼d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1457-8. Comp. dompni Ricardi Wrake. (In a bad state).
DIV2.P: Rec. 91li. 8s. 9¾d. Including (hides) de melioribus trium slaughtere.

DIV2.HEAD: 1475-6. Comp. d'ni Will. Rodburne.
DIV2.P: Rec. 91li. 7s. 4d. (Scathaver continues).
Emp. pannor. Sagum continues.
Exp. novic. 8 pair of boots for 4 novices, in the year, at 15d. and 16d.
Nova Rastura. For two; including 2 cuculli pro ludis.
Pensiones. 40s. in relev. mon.; 20s. in rel. feretr.; Joh'i Steyll cantori, 13s. 4d.
Exp. nec. Reparac. murorum juxta scaccariam, cum j cado empt. ad portand. aquam, 3s. 6d.
Repar. Molend. de Hemingb., ut patet per compotum, 4li. 3d.

Alloc. 28s. de firma unius piscarie in aqua de Ouse quia vastatur; 5s. alterius piscarie in aqua de Derwent; 2s. pro le stakgarth, in manu d'ni; 5s. de firma terre vocate Partrikland onerat. ad 15s. et inde rec. nisi 10s.; 6s. 8d. de firma molend. de Hemingb. eo quod oneratur ad 33s. 4d. et dimittitur nisi pro 26s. 8d.; et de 13s. pro molend. predicto jacente in manu d'ni causa reparacionis, videlicet pro defectu postis.
Exp. 96li. 7s. 10¼d.
Endorsed in old hand, W. Rothbury, 1475.

DIV2.HEAD: 1476-7. Comp. ejusdem (cum dupl.).
DIV2.P: Rec. 30s. de Cellerario Dunelm. pro 15 corriis boum et electis de melioribus trium Slaughters.
Rec. 91li. 3s. 11d.
Exp. 91li. 19s. 6½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1478-9. Comp. ejusdem.
DIV2.P: Rec. 93li. 5s. 5d.
Exp. novic. In emendacione iiijor dormondez pro eisdem.
Nova Rastura. For four.
Exp. nec. Pro una nova situla facta cum ligatur. ferr. pro eadem pro aqua haurienda, 9d.
Exp., etc. 96li. 10s. 3½d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1480-1. Comp. ejusdem.
DIV2.P: Rec. 91li. 2s. 1d.
Pensiones. Joh'i Steyll, Cantori, pro pensione nuper sibi soluta, 13s. 4d. Et M. Roberto Bartram pro pensione nuper sibi soluta, 6s. 8d., 20s. Ep'o puerili Elem., 2s.
Reparac. Pro repar. fact. apud Hemingb. super factura unius patibuli et j batelli, unius paris molarum cum cariag. empt. pro molend. de Hemingb., 29s. 2d.
Exp., etc. 85li. 9s. 10d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1481-2. Comp. ejusdem (much of it gone).
DIV2.P: Rec. Gone.
Nova Rastura. For six. Pens. Cantori as in last account.
Exp. nec. Ep'o puerili Elem., 2s.
